page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: This farm also grows about 240 acres of barley.This consists of one field of malt barley,which is sent to a distillery,and one field of seed barley which is used to feed the cattle in the winter.Mr Johnston used to grow oats and wheat but he has stopped growing those now and so have many farmers who now grow oilseed rape which is a profitable alternative. Oilseed rape is crushed for oil. Turnips are also grown on the farms but these are not good enough for human eating so the farmer might sell them off to a cattle farmer.Most of the farmers rear cattle for beef. Vegetables such as peas are grown and crushed as protein for the cattle. Some prize crops of peas can be sold to supermarkets.The average size of farm is about 300 acres.Most of the farm buildings have been renovated
